description.narrative:
Target area: Gaza Province (Guijá, Chicualacuala, Mabalane and Chigubo districts).
Target number of beneficiaries: 14,460 Households (72,300 individuals) Goal: To mitigate the negative impacts of drought impacting the lives of children and families in Mozambiquethrough Food Security and Livelihoods, WASH and Nutrition interventions. Impact: To ensure children and their parents/children and their parents/careers in Gaza Province are able to meet basic needs to enable a healthy and dignified life at all times without engaging in negative coping mechanisms. Outcome: Affected households have adequate access to food and water and nutritional support to meet their daily essential needs, as well as access to market integrated livelihood activities which support their children#s wellbeing. (For the II phase of this project, SCI have targeted 4,000 HH in the same locations only for FSL activities)
Sector Objectives: WASH Sector - Affected communities have access to and use safe water and sanitation, and adopt improved hygiene practices, leading to reduced incidence of diarrhea and therefore risks of under/malnutrition. Output 1: Targeted households have sustained access to safe water in sufficient quantity (for their own consumption), and improved knowledge of hygiene and sanitation practices
FSL Sector- To enable crisis-affected households to cover their immediate needs and protect/restore their livelihoods options without having to employ harmful coping strategies, especially those that pose anincreased risk to women and children. Output 2: 14,460 vulnerable households in communities receive essential foodbaskets through market integrated support Output 3: 14,460 vulnerable households provided with livelihood inputs and support (For the II phase of the project, 4,000 kits of seeds will be distributed through beneficiaries, farmers will be trained in Fall Army Worms and post harvest technologies)
Nutrition Sector - Establish / Provide screening and referral mechanisms to rapidly ensure treatment for severe and moderate acute malnutrition (SAM and MAM) and reduce the incidence of malnutrition in communities Output 4: More than 50% of SAM and MAM cases from the target communities are identified and referred to the respective nutritional rehabilitation services Output 5:District health services have increased capacity to plan for emergency nutrition responses
Child Protection - Promote community awareness and engagement in the protection of marginalized populations including women and children. Output 6: Increased awareness and participation of field staff and community on key child protection issues.

participating-org.narrative: Save The Children International Children Protection Organization

Save the Children International Save is a non-governmental organization for the defense of children's rights in the world, was established in the UK in 1919, dedicated to both provide emergency humanitarian aid as the long-term development through the child sponsorship . Save the Children began working in Mozambique in 1984, providing emergency assistance to children and families displaced bywar, and gave their contribution to the reconstruction of the health system. Since 1995, Save the Children in Mozambique has workedwith local communities and organizations to design Sponsorship programs for kids. Targeted to help children from early childhood toearly adulthood, our programs work to make a healthy and safe environment where children can learn andgrow. Our early childhood programs help prepare toddlers and young children for school by giving them access to quality preschools and early literacy programs, while our programs designed for primary school-aged kids work to transform students into lifelong learners by building strong curriculums and passionate teachers. Our work with adolescents focuses on that challenging transition between childhood and adulthood, helping ensure it#s a positive one by teaching them money, job and relationship skills. We also provide health education and care to children in need through our school health programs to help children stay healthy, well-nourished and in school. Thanks to the generoussupport from our community of sponsors, these essential programs in Mozambique continue to give children a healthy start and the opportunity to learn, protecting them from harm along the way.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
